example: it.  You use it when the thing following a verb or preposition is the same as the subject of the sentence.  [cf2]The cat was washing itself. [j33] The path doubled back on itself
The house itself was undamaged, but part of the garage burned down. [j33] This is not a problem in itself, but it may lead to difficulties
